intro: Dimeiostemon tetrastachys, commonly known as the four-branched bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy surface. The four-branched structure of its inflorescence is a notable botanical feature.
